description: Reverse of triangle A053218, read by rows.
comments: First element in each row gives A001792. Difference between center element of row 2n-1 and row sum of row n (A053220(n+4) - A053221(n+4)) gives A045618(n).Subtriangle of triangle in A062111. - _Philippe Del√©ham_, Nov 21 2011Can be seen as the transform of 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, ... by a variant of the boustrophedon algorithm (see the Sage implementation). - _Peter Luschny_, Oct 30 2014
prog: (Sage)def u():    for n in PositiveIntegers():        yield ndef bous_variant(f):    k = 0    am = f.next()    a = [am]    while True:        yield list(a)        am = f.next()        a.append(am)        for m in range(k,-1,-1):            am += a[m]            a[m] = am        k += 1b = bous_variant(u())[b.next() for _ in range(8)] # _Peter Luschny_, Oct 30 2014
crossrefs: Cf. A053218 (reverse of this triangle), A053220 (center elements), A053221 (row sums), A001792, A045618, A062111.
author: Asher Auel (asher.auel(AT)reed.edu) Jan 01 2000
